alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 29 at 10:09AM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... South Platte River near Roscoe affecting Deuel and Keith Counties. .Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall in Colorado continues to flow down the South Platte river, pushing the river at Roscoe to just above flood stage. The River is forecast to fall below flood stage Friday morning. For the South Platte River...including Roscoe...Minor flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River near Roscoe. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood Stage. Minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM MDT Thursday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain at or slightly above flood stage through this afternoon and fall below below flood stage Friday morning. The river is expected to continue to fall through the weekend into early next week. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 06/10/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun South Platte River Roscoe 9.0 9.1 Thu 7 am MDT 8.7 8.1 7.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
